result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph S. Ferguson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $131.75 plus surcharges.  Joint & Severally w/ 15CF383.
May not have contact with Bobby P or Brendan S or Toppers Pizza, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges - STILL DUE AND OWING.
++  Pay restitution plus surcharges - STILL DUE AND OWING.  May Not have contact with known felons unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision. of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 5 years w/conditions, consecutive to current sentence; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; restitution ordered in the amount of $131.75 joint & several with 15CF383.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 2/29/16 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty J Breitenbach appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft was not writted.  Atty Breitenbach reports that the case is resolved.  PLEAH set for 1/8/16 at 11:45am.  Bond continued.
2nd amended  Demand for discovery - filed by ADA R Delgado.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Jerold Breitenbach.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Ludwig hearing held; plea offer is rejected by the defendant.  Jury status hearing 12/16/15 at 1:15.  Jury trial (pick and go) 1/19/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, STC continued to 10/6/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Breitenbach states he received a written offer that he needs time to discuss w/deft; states the deft is waiting for conclusion of revocation hearing set for 9/10/15 that ADA Delgado wants to obtain a transcript of.  ADA Delgado moves to adjourn trial.  JS on 9/14/15 at 8:30am is removed from the calendar and a STC is set for 9/18/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Breitenbach's motion to sever.  State does not oppose motion.  Court allows case severed from 15CF383 & 15CF384.  JSH 8/27/15 at 1:15pm and JS 9/14/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Breitenbach.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Breitenbach states the two co-deft's made statements against his client.  ADA Delgado states she needs time to review the file.  STC set for 6/22/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. Joseph Ferguson appeared (in custody) with Atty. Jerold Breitenbach. Def. Bobby Price appeared (in custody) with Atty. Terry Rose. Def. Brendan Styles appeared (in custody) with Atty. Don Bielski. Clerk LE. Preliminary hearings held jointly for co-defs in 15CF382, 383, and 384. KPD Det. Leonard Giannola sworn in and testified on behalf of State. Cross-examination by Atty. Breitenbach. Cross-examination by Atty. Rose. Cross-examination by Atty. Bielski. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 6-4-15 @ 8:15am with co-defs. Bond continued.
atty: J Breitenbach
